title: How to Make Maple and Pecan Muffins

steps.headline: Combine water and flaxseed meal.
steps.description: Add flaxseed meal and water into a bowl. Mix together and set aside for 10 minutes or until thickened.

steps.headline: Whisk dry ingredients.
steps.description: In a separate bowl add pecans, salt, baking powder, baking soda, coconut flour and all purpose flour. Whisk until well combined.

steps.headline: Add wet ingredients.
steps.description: Incorporate the vanilla extract, coconut oil, maple syrup and flaxseed mixture into the dry ingredients until well combined.

steps.headline: Prepare muffin tray.
steps.description: Grease the muffin tray with coconut oil or use muffin wrappers to prevent sticking.

steps.headline: Distribute the batter.
steps.description: Scoop the batter with an icecream scoop to evenly distribute the batter.

steps.headline: Place the muffins in the oven.
steps.description: Bake the muffins for 17 minutes or until slightly brown and a toothpick inserted in the middle comes out clean.

steps.headline: Serve.
steps.description: Allow the muffins to cool before digging in.

text: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).  Combine water and flaxseed meal. Add flaxseed meal and water into a bowl. Mix together and set aside for 10 minutes or until thickened. Whisk dry ingredients. In a separate bowl add pecans, salt, baking powder, baking soda, coconut flour and all purpose flour. Whisk until well combined. Add wet ingredients. Incorporate the vanilla extract, coconut oil, maple syrup and flaxseed mixture into the dry ingredients until well combined. Prepare muffin tray. Grease the muffin tray with coconut oil or use muffin wrappers to prevent sticking. Distribute the batter. Scoop the batter with an icecream scoop to evenly distribute the batter. Place the muffins in the oven. Bake the muffins for 17 minutes or until slightly brown and a toothpick inserted in the middle comes out clean. Serve. Allow the muffins to cool before digging in.
